name: Sameer Sawla
bio:
I am studying Info Tech., have bachelors in Comp Sci from India and couple of years of experience of working in India’s second largest IT firm, Infosys Limited. My most recent experience was building an application for a client in NJ which incorporated php5, HTML5 , javascript and CSS on the front end and Java as the backend. I am quite comfortable working in C++, Java, JavaScript. I totally want to learn more about d3JS and AngularJS. Also want to learn a bit of EmberJS if time supports. Have interest in developing NLP applications but haven’t taken any course of the same in the school. 

My relax time starts when I play my guitar. I am actually planning to buy a PS3 console just because I want to explore on the game RockSmith-2014, which looks totally awesome. Not into reading paperbacks, online reading is so much portable and fun. 

So excited to be a part in this enormous innovative digital transformation that Cengage Learning is going through!

name: Sanat Chugh
bio:
Nickname: flow
Role: Software Engineering Intern
Equipment: 2.6 Ghz Intel Core i7 Mac Mini
	   Samsung SyncMaster 2494
	   Lenovo ThinkVision 24"
	   Apple Keyboard with Numeric Keypad
	   Logitech M110
Experience at Cengage: When I joined Cengage Learning I was excited and motivated. Nothing has changed ever since. Cengage Learning has helped me understand what I am good at what I am not. Interestingly if I am not good at something I landed up becoming good at it thanks to the support of my managers and colleagues. Cengage is one of the best decisions I have made. I feel I have achieved what I looked for in an internship: Work and Fun. The work enviornment is chill. The assignments and tasks are challenging. At Cengage I worked on the Internationalization team (making MindTaptake over the world) and the MindTap Health Check team (keeping track of MindTap performance). 
MindTap, Agile Development, Clean Code, Test driven Development, WISE Wednesdays, Nerf Guns, Tricycles, Skate Boards, Guitars, Record Player, World Cup 2014, and Soccer matches. Just another day in the office!
Technical Knowledge Gained: JavaScript, JQuery, CSS,  i18next, Selenium WebDriver, Navigation Timing API, Resource Timing API
Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Engage me and I Learn.

name: Steven Yee
bio: I am a rising junior majoring in Computer Science and Economics. Back in my beautiful hometown of Honolulu, I am known for my incredible surfing and basketball abilities. Although I have just learned to play 'football,' my game has been compared favorably to that of Lionel Messi. I hope to get transferred to FC Barcelona once I complete my internship at Cengage. My favorite thing about interning at Cengage has been getting to meet so many great people.

name: Roseanna Chu
bio: I'm currently a rising junior majoring in Finance and Information Systems, with a major interest in Computer Science.

name: Sanket Tandulwadkar
bio: Computer Science graduate student at University of Massachusetts Lowell. Loving my 11 weeks and Cengage. Made a lot of new friends. Cookies.Sleep.League.Repeat. ~ Mantra for life. Like they say, keep it simple and short.

name: Kevin Hilt
reknown: South Dakota School of Mines and Technology
bio: I will be a junior next year majoring in Computer Science. I have enjoyed by time working at Cengage by watching Sameer code and taking credit for some of it. I have also enjoyed getting beaten at soccer when we play on Fridays, and listening to Sanket talk about how he always wants cookies.

name: Dalton Morris
bio: I am a rising Sophomore at the University of Colorado, Boulder hoping to pursue something business or econmics related. When I'm not busy working at Cengage, you can find me teaching my coworkers how to play soccer (as it is called in America), skiing, or playing on the lake. Interning here has been a wonderful experience and I've gotten to know some truly great and brillaint people.
